transcripts.text: It was a sight worth stopping for.  Three young men helping an elderly couple struggling to get to their car.
Sheriff's deputy Kenisha Carnegie was driving by at the time.

As I was sitting there, I looked to my left and I noticed these young men helping this elderly couple.  So I went over to assist them.  I jumped out my truck.  I went over to assist them.  And when I got there, they kind of had it under control, you know, so I thought at the time they looked really beautiful.  That was a nice view to see, you know, and I stepped back and I just videoed them.
Watch as they carefully lift 89-year-old Rose Grease into her car.  Rose's 100-year-old husband, David, stands nearby.  The men don't leave until they make sure the couple is safely inside.
Thank you so much, fellas.  That's fine, bro.  I'm not... I'm a hundred years old.
Thank you.  Kenisha says she hopes the video inspires others to lend a helping hand.

That's the beauty of it, to see them, to let their parents, even their parents, their mothers, their fathers, you know, their grandparents, to see something.  I didn't anticipate this to go viral.  I didn't anticipate this at all.  Thank you.
